xxl.core.cursors
Class Subquery<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.Subquery<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by this iteration.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator<E>, Cursor<E>, Binding<E>
public class Subquery<E>
extends SecureDecoratorCursor<E>
implements Binding<E>

This class is a prototypical implementation for subqueries which may be used in exist, all, any predicates, etc. It allows to treat a part of the parameters of a subquery as free variables and delivers the result when they are bound.

The cursor of the subquery has to support the reset-method. After one reset the result has to be recomputed and must not be buffered.

See Also:
AllPredicate, AnyPredicate, ExistPredicate

Constructor Detail

Subquery

public Subquery(Cursor<E> outCursor,
                List<? extends Binding<E>> bindings,
                int[][] mConstIndices)
Creates a new instance of a subquery. It allow to treat a part of the parameters of a subquery as free variables and delivers the result when they are bound.

Parameters:
outCursor - the subquery, whose result will be delivered when its free variables are bound.
bindings - the bindings used in this subquery.
mConstIndices - the two-dimensional array saving information of the free variables.
Example:
mConstIndices[i][j]=k: the j-th free variable is the k-th parameter of the i-th binding.
k=-1: the free variable is not used in the binding.
Method Detail

bind

public void bind(List<? extends E> arguments)
Set the values of the free variables of the subquery.

Parameters:
arguments - the objects to which the free variables of the wrapped subquery should be bound.

restoreBinds

public void restoreBinds()
Remove all bindings from the free variables of the subquery, i.e., restore the initial state of the subquery without any bindings.

Specified by:
restoreBinds in interface Binding<E>

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples of how to use an exist predicate. It can also be used to test the functionality of the exist predicate.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
